alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued October 18 at 2:55PM EDT until October 18 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow will continue into this evening before diminishing. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches in the higher terrain west of Marquette a few miles inland from Lake Superior. Near the shoreline, little or no snow accumulation will occur due to rain only or rain mixing with the snow at times. North winds will gust to 35 to 45 mph along Lake Superior from Big Bay to Shot Point. * WHERE...Marquette County. * WHEN...Until 8 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches, resulting in potentially widespread power outages.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
